author: Special Correspondent
text:
“Restore Vitta Vasal”

A public interest litigation (PIL) petition has been filed in the Madras High Court Bench here seeking a direction to officials of Archaeology Department to restore ‘Vitta Vasal,’ one of the four ancient gateways that once marked the boundary of Madurai, situated on the periphery of the Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple here.

Advocate K. Pandi Arasan had filed the case alleging that the eastern gateway constructed by the Pandyas during the 13{+t}{+h}century was now lying uncared for despite it being the only gateway to have survived till date since the other three gateways were demolished during the British regime in 1857 by then Collector to pave way for expansion of the city.
title: PIL to restore Vitta Vasal
